result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Sheena Lee Martinson was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sheena Lee Martinson in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Defendant Sheena Lee Martinson in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  State moves to amend Ct #1 to Straight OWI 3, striking the enhancer which modifies the charge down to a Misd.  DE pleads No Contest to amended charge.  Found Guilty.  Sentence imposed:  90 days county jail, with Huber and DE is eligible for good time.  DE has credit for 23 days.  DL is revoked 24 months, IID on any vehicle owned or operated 24 months effective 45 days from today.  Pay fine/costs totalling $2042.00 which includes $200 DNA surcharge and DE must provide DNA sample.    OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.    Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.
Ct #2 is dismissed.  Ct #3 is dismissed and read in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Combined Bond  16CF165, 16CF43, 16CF230 and 16CF223
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages. No drug use without a valid prescription. 
May not be on the premises of any establishment that serves alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING of his/her blood, breath or urine, as defined by the Sawyer County STOP program and is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 24 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) #715-638-3317 and to establish the procedures for the testing.

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a STOP case manager (715-638-3317)for the purpose of  learning about the Court's intoxicated driver intervention program.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
Defendant shall be subject to Random Testing of his/her blood breath or unine and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. Failure to report to STOP Program may result in the issuance of a warrant for the defendant's arrest, modification of bail, possible bail jumping charges and/or forfeiture of bail.
